extends java.net.Socket

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String host)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Connects to the specified host using the default port. If the string contains port information (using the format host:port), it is decoded.
        Parameters:
        host - Host to connect.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String host,
           int port)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Connects to the specified host using the specified port.
        Parameters:
        host - Host to connect.
        port - Port to use.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • receive

        public HTTPMessage receive()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Receives a HTTP message from the socket. Currently it is only supported to receive HTTP responses.
        Returns:
        A new HTTPMessage object with the message read or null if the end of stream was reached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • reconnect

        public void reconnect()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Reconnects to the last used host, and using the last used port.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • send

        public void send(HTTPMessage msg)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a HTTP message. Currently it is only supported to send HTTP requests.
        Parameters:
        msg - A HTTPMessage object with the message.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
